isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - REMOVE - UPPER DOOR TRIM/INNER DOOR PANEL AND WINDOW REGULATOR ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: UPPER DOOR TRIM/INNER DOOR PANEL AND WINDOW REGULATOR ASSEMBLY

svcsubproc.title: Remove Driver Side Upper Door Trim/Inner Door Panel and Window Regulator Assembly

note.para: If door has electrically controlled windows, door locks, mirrors, heated mirrors or CB antenna and door wiring harness is being replaced, disconnect wiring harness connectors to remove upper door trim/inner door panel and window regulator assembly as described below.

step1.para:
Remove driver side cab door lower trim panel from cab door. Refer to
CAB DOOR LOWER TRIM PANEL
, Remove Driver Side Cab Door Lower Trim Panel.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 37 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To disconnect electrical cable connections from cab to driver side cab door, remove cab front insulator panel (Item 1) under instrument panel by removing two black plastic trim fasteners (Item 2) from top flange, then remove one self tapping pan head screw and washer (Item 3) and remove front insulator panel.
Remove two pan head screws (Item 4) and remove dimmer switch (Item 5) to make it easier to remove cab side insulator panel (Item 6).

Remove cab side insulator panel (Item 6) on driver side by removing one black plastic trim fasteners (Item 7) from top flange, then remove two self tapping pan head screws and washers (Item 8) and remove cab side insulator panel.

figure.caption: Figure 37. Front and Side Insulator Panel

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. SELF TAPPING PAN HEAD SCREW, 10-16 X 1 AND WASHER, .219 ID X .5 OD
8. SELF TAPPING PAN HEAD SCREW, 10-16 X 1 AND WASHER, .219 ID X .5 OD

step1.para: If vehicle is equipped with electric windows, use electric window switch button and lower window so the two hex head mach. screws (Item 5, Figure 41) are accessible through oval opening in center of inner door panel (Item 6, Figure 41) before disconnecting connectors in following step.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 38 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Reach under dash panel near outer cab wall and pull cable assembly down to access electrical cable connectors. Disconnect courtesy light connector (Item 1) and CB cable connector (Item 2), if so equipped, and disconnect electric window connector (Item 3) and electric door lock connector (Item 4). If vehicle is equipped with heated mirrors and/or electric mirrors, disconnect connectors for them also.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 39 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once connectors are disconnected, carefully pull electrical cable (Item 1) through side of cab (Item 2), cab hinge pillar (Item 3) and cab hinge pillar grommet (Item 4); each connector will have to be pulled through separately.

figure.caption: Figure 39. Electrical Cable and Connectors inside Cab

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 40 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two pan head mach. screws (Item 1) securing cab door check strap (Item 2) to cab door frame (Item 3).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 41 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Unscrew door lock knob (Item 1) from door lock control rod (Item 2) sticking through opening in upper door trim/inner door panel and window regulator assembly (Item 3).

If vehicle window is manually operated, temporarily slide window regulator handle (Item 2, Figure 35) onto window regulator handle shaft (Item 4) and lower window so the two hex head mach. screws (Item 5) are accessible through oval opening in the center of inner door panel (Item 6). If vehicle has electric windows this should have been done in Step 5 above so that Step 12 below can be accomplished.

Before removing two hex head mach. screws (Item 5) accessible through oval opening in the center of inner door panel (Item 6), place a wood block (Item 7), 12.5 inches long, through opening in inner door panel between bottom of window and bottom of door to prop window up so it will not fall to the bottom of cab door. This will prevent having to try and lift window back into position during installation.
Remove two hex head mach. screws (Item 5) securing window regulator assembly to window regulator bracket on window.

Through electric door lock actuator access opening in inner door panel (Item 6), slide retaining clip (Item 8) off electric door lock control rod from electric door lock actuator (Item 9) and remove it from electric door lock control rod (Item 10).

figure.caption: Figure 41. Upper Door Trim/Inner Door Panel and Window Regulator Assembly

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. UPPER DOOR TRIM/INNER DOOR PANEL AND WINDOW REGULATOR ASSEMBLY
5. HEX HEAD MACH. SCREWS, 1/4-28 UNF x 3/4

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 42 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Squeeze lower mirror mounting bracket plastic cover (Item 1) on both sides and remove it to access electrical cable connectors (Item 2). Disconnect all connectors required, such as CB cable connector, and if so equipped, electric mirror and/or heated mirror connectors.

figure.caption: Figure 42. Electrical Cable and Connectors to Mirror

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. LOWER MIRROR MOUNTING BRACKET PLASTIC COVER
4. OPENING IN MIRROR MOUNTING BRACKET AND CAB DOOR

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 41 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove six pan head torx screws (Item 11) from upper door trim/inner door panel and window regulator assembly (Item 3).
Lift upper door trim/inner door panel and window regulator assembly (Item 3) up over door lock control rod (Item 2).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 43 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Hold upper door trim/inner door panel and window regulator assembly (Item 1) away from cab door enough to disconnect two piece control rod (Item 2) from inner door handle (Item 3) to door latch assembly (Item 4). Slide retaining clip (Item 5) off inner door handle control rod (Item 6) and remove it from door latch inner door handle control rod (Item 7).

While holding upper door trim/inner door panel and window regulator assembly (Item 1) away from cab door, disconnect cab door courtesy light switch connector (Item 8) from cab door courtesy light switch.

figure.caption: Figure 43. Upper Door Trim/Inner Door Panel and Window Regulator Assembly Connections

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. UPPER DOOR TRIM/INNER DOOR PANEL AND WINDOW REGULATOR ASSEMBLY
7. DOOR LATCH INNER DOOR HANDLE CONTROL ROD
8. CAB DOOR COURTESY LIGHT SWITCH CONNECTOR

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 44 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Carefully pull cab door electrical cable (Item 1) through cab door and cab door hinge; each connector will have to be pulled through separately. Also carefully pull mirror electrical cable (Item 2) through opening in mirror mounting bracket and cab door; each connector will have to be pulled through separately. Now upper door trim/inner door panel and window regulator assembly (Item 3) is free of cab door and can be placed out of the way where it will not get damaged. Save for reinstallation.

figure.caption: Figure 44. Cab Door and Mirror Electrical Cable

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. UPPER DOOR TRIM/INNER DOOR PANEL AND WINDOW REGULATOR ASSEMBLY

step1.para: If replacing door wiring harness, disconnect connectors to electric door lock actuator and electric door window motor as required, then push the push-in fasteners on wiring harness through upper door trim/inner door panel and window regulator assembly and remove door wiring harness.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Passenger Side Upper Door Trim/Inner Door Panel and Window Regulator Assembly

note.para: If door has electrically controlled windows, door locks, mirrors, heated mirrors or CB antenna and door wiring harness is being replaced, disconnect wiring harness connectors to remove upper door trim/inner door panel and window regulator assembly as described below.

step1.para:
Remove passenger side cab door lower trim panel from cab door. Refer to
CAB DOOR LOWER TRIM PANEL
, Remove Passenger Side Cab Door Lower Trim Panel.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 45 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To disconnect electrical cable connections from cab to passenger side cab door, remove cab front insulator panel (Item 1) under instrument panel by removing three black plastic trim fasteners (Item 2) from top flange, then remove four self tapping pan head screws and washers (Item 3) and remove front insulator panel.
Remove cab side insulator panel (Item 4) on passenger side by removing two self tapping pan head screws and washer (Item 5) and remove cab side insulator panel.

figure.caption: Figure 45. Front and Side Insulator Panel

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. SELF TAPPING PAN HEAD SCREW, 10-16 X 1 AND WASHER, .219 ID X .5 OD
5. SELF TAPPING PAN HEAD SCREW, 10-16 X 1 AND WASHER, .219 ID X .5 OD

step1.para: If vehicle is equipped with electric windows use electric window button and lower window so the two hex head mach. screws (Item 5, Figure 49) are accessible through oval opening in center of inner door panel (Item 6, Figure 49) before disconnecting connectors in following step.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 46 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Reach under dash panel near outer cab wall and pull cable assembly down to access electrical cable connectors. Disconnect courtesy light connector (Item 1) and CB cable connector (Item 2). If so equipped, disconnect electric window connector (Item 3) and electric door lock connector (Item 4). If vehicle is equipped with heated mirrors and/or electric mirrors, disconnect connectors for them also.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 47 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once connectors are disconnected, carefully pull electrical cable (Item 1) through side of cab (Item 2), cab hinge pillar (Item 3) and cab hinge pillar grommet (Item 4); each connector will have to be pulled through separately.

figure.caption: Figure 47. Electrical Cable and Connectors inside Cab

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 48 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Remove two pan head mach. screws (Item 1) securing cab door check strap (Item 2) to cab door frame (Item 3).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 49 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Unscrew door lock knob (Item 1) from door lock control rod (Item 2) sticking through opening in upper door trim/inner door panel and window regulator assembly (Item 3).

If vehicle window is manually operated, temporarily slide window regulator handle (Item 2, Figure 36) onto window regulator handle shaft (Item 4) and lower window so the two hex head mach. screws (Item 5) are accessible through oval opening in the center of inner door panel (Item 6). If vehicle has electric windows this should have been done in Step 4 above so that Step 11 below can be accomplished.

Before removing two hex head mach. screws (Item 5) accessible through oval opening in the center of inner door panel (Item 6), place a wood block (Item 7), 12.5 inches long, through opening in inner door panel between bottom of window and bottom of door to prop window up so it will not fall to the bottom of cab door. This will prevent having to try and lift window back into position during installation.
Remove two hex head mach. screws (Item 5) securing window regulator assembly to window regulator bracket on window.

Through electric door lock actuator access opening in inner door panel (Item 6), slide retaining clip (Item 8) off electric door lock control rod from electric door lock actuator (Item 9) and remove it from electric door lock control rod (Item 10).

figure.caption: Figure 49. Upper Door Trim/Inner Door Panel and Window Regulator Assembly

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. UPPER DOOR TRIM/INNER DOOR PANEL AND WINDOW REGULATOR ASSEMBLY
5. HEX HEAD MACH. SCREWS, 1/4-28 UNF x 3/4

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 50 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Squeeze lower mirror mounting bracket plastic cover (Item 1) on both sides and remove it to access electrical cable connectors (Item 2). Disconnect all connectors required, such as CB cable connector, and if so equipped, electric mirror and/or heated mirror connectors.

figure.caption: Figure 50. Electrical Cable and Connectors to Mirror

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. LOWER MIRROR MOUNTING BRACKET PLASTIC COVER
4. OPENING IN MIRROR MOUNTING BRACKET AND CAB DOOR

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 49 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove six pan head torx screws (Item 11) from upper door trim/inner door panel and window regulator assembly (Item 3).
Lift upper door trim/inner door panel and window regulator assembly (Item 3) up over door lock control rod (Item 2).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 51 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Hold upper door trim/inner door panel and window regulator assembly (Item 1) away from cab door enough to disconnect two piece control rod (Item 2) from inner door handle (Item 3) to door latch assembly (Item 4). Slide retaining clip (Item 5) off inner door handle control rod (Item 6) and remove it from door latch inner door handle control rod (Item 7).

While holding upper door trim/inner door panel and window regulator assembly (Item 1) away from cab door, disconnect cab door courtesy light switch connector (Item 8) from cab door courtesy light switch.

figure.caption: Figure 51. Upper Door Trim/Inner Door Panel and Window Regulator Assembly Connections

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. UPPER DOOR TRIM/INNER DOOR PANEL AND WINDOW REGULATOR ASSEMBLY
7. DOOR LATCH INNER DOOR HANDLE CONTROL ROD
8. CAB DOOR COURTESY LIGHT SWITCH CONNECTOR

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 52 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Carefully pull cab door electrical cable (Item 1) through cab door and cab door hinge; each connector will have to be pulled through separately. Also carefully pull mirror electrical cable (Item 2) through opening in mirror mounting bracket and cab door; each connector will have to be pulled through separately. Now upper door trim/inner door panel and window regulator assembly (Item 3) is free of cab door and can be placed out of the way where it will not get damaged. Save for reinstallation.

figure.caption: Figure 52. Cab Door and Mirror Electrical Cable

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. UPPER DOOR TRIM/INNER DOOR PANEL AND WINDOW REGULATOR ASSEMBLY

step1.para: If replacing door wiring harness, disconnect connectors to electric door lock actuator and electric door window motor as required, then push the push-in fasteners on wiring harness through upper door trim/inner door panel and window regulator assembly and remove door wiring harness.
